$interpreted: Flattering Noble: Sir Aldric, may I have a word?
Flattering Noble: ...My apologies, just a minute of your time.
Flattering Noble: My daughter's coming of age ceremony is next week, and we would be honored if you could grace us with your presence, Sir Aldric.
Ace: I unfortunately have another engagement, but will send over a gift.
Flattering Noble: A gift? You are most gracious, Sir Ace! Such a busy man, I am most honored indeed!
Flattering Noble: Ah, now that I think of it, is it not also Miss Sione's coming of age ceremony soon?
Flattering Noble: Would it not be auspicious for Miss Sione and my son to share a meal together, I suppose they--
Ace: What did you say?
Flattering Noble: B-B-Both of them just entered the army last year, so...
Flattering Noble: I thought they c-c-could have a c-c-chat, and...
Ace: A chat about what? How to best serve their kingdom?
Ace: As you said, Sione only joined the army last year. Instead of chatting with boys, I rather think she should be focusing on her training.
Ace: Do you not agree?
Flattering Noble: Y-Y-Yes, of course! Please, I didn't mean anything by it!
Ace: When is the last time the new recruits' barracks were inspected?
Nervous Guard: Three days ago, sir.
Ace: ...It's been quite a while.
Ace: Cancel my afternoon plans, we're heading to Paradise Prairie.
Nervous Guard: The lord's concept of 'quite a while' is a bit different from most people's...
Quiet Guard: I wonder what he'd do if Sione ever started to fancy someone? You reckon he'd...
Nervous Guard: Shhh! Watch your tongue! Let's just catch up to the others...
Nervous Guard: Strange, the beasts here should be quite tame. Why are the troops having such trouble?
Ace: It is their mating season. The beasts become ferocious when they're in heat.
Quiet Guard: Should we lend the new recruits some assistance, sir?
Ace: No need. They should learn to deal with these problems on their own. We won't always be around to lend a hand.
New Soldier: Help! Somebody help us!!
Quiet Guard: Y-Yes, sir, but the beasts really are quite riled up today... And these recruits have barely gone through basic training. Maybe we should...
Ace: Hmph... I suppose you're right. Let's give them a hand.
Nervous Guard: ......
Nervous Guard: Yes, sir!
New Soldier: Thank you for saving us, Sir Ace!
New Soldier: Are you here to inspect the barracks? Let us escort you!
Ace: No need. You should work on taking care of yourselves before you entrust the safety of others into your own hands.
Rookie Soldier: Wow, Sir Ace is so magnificent... I guess I shouldn't expect any less from Sione's big brother.
New Soldier: Yeah... That's why that idiot Wendel's got no chance of being with an Aldric. Even if Sione likes him...
Ace: What did you just say?
New Soldier: Ah, I-I didn't say anything, Sir Aldric!
Ace: You know it's a severe punishment, gossiping behind a noble's back.
New Soldier: Apologies! I don't deserve forgiveness!!
Ace: Enough, say that again... Who does Sione like!?

Model.Text: Sir Aldric, may I have a word?
...My apologies, just a minute of your time.
My daughter's coming of age ceremony is next week, and we would be honored if you could grace us with your presence, Sir Aldric.
I unfortunately have another engagement, but will send over a gift.
A gift? You are most gracious, Sir Ace! Such a busy man, I am most honored indeed!
Ah, now that I think of it, is it not also Miss Sione's coming of age ceremony soon?
Would it not be auspicious for Miss Sione and my son to share a meal together, I suppose they--
What did you say?
B-B-Both of them just entered the army last year, so...
I thought they c-c-could have a c-c-chat, and...
A chat about what? How to best serve their kingdom?
As you said, Sione only joined the army last year. Instead of chatting with boys, I rather think she should be focusing on her training.
Do you not agree?
Y-Y-Yes, of course! Please, I didn't mean anything by it!
When is the last time the new recruits' barracks were inspected?
Three days ago, sir.
...It's been quite a while.
Cancel my afternoon plans, we're heading to Paradise Prairie.
The lord's concept of 'quite a while' is a bit different from most people's...
I wonder what he'd do if Sione ever started to fancy someone? You reckon he'd...
Shhh! Watch your tongue! Let's just catch up to the others...
Strange, the beasts here should be quite tame. Why are the troops having such trouble?
It is their mating season. The beasts become ferocious when they're in heat.
Should we lend the new recruits some assistance, sir?
No need. They should learn to deal with these problems on their own. We won't always be around to lend a hand.
Help! Somebody help us!!
Y-Yes, sir, but the beasts really are quite riled up today... And these recruits have barely gone through basic training. Maybe we should...
Hmph... I suppose you're right. Let's give them a hand.
Yes, sir!
Thank you for saving us, Sir Ace!
Are you here to inspect the barracks? Let us escort you!
No need. You should work on taking care of yourselves before you entrust the safety of others into your own hands.
Wow, Sir Ace is so magnificent... I guess I shouldn't expect any less from Sione's big brother.
Yeah... That's why that idiot Wendel's got no chance of being with an Aldric. Even if Sione likes him...
What did you just say?
Ah, I-I didn't say anything, Sir Aldric!
You know it's a severe punishment, gossiping behind a noble's back.
Apologies! I don't deserve forgiveness!!
Enough, say that again... Who does Sione like!?
